"it's good but not that good"

It took less than 2 minutes to install, 1 minute to exhaust the lifespan of the 3 different levels or stages within and then under 1 minute to get rid of it and wake up tommorow hopefully forgetting it exists in the Oculus library. Seriously - this is like witnessing some young devs first attempt at getting a game to work for the first time, everything is awful, the droning sound fx, poorly animated "badies", weapons, buggy behaviour, controlls, lifespan - EVERYTHING! ok, ok so its content, it does run but why on earth is this in the market as if its a finished project or game, its clearly not! when you can literaly poke your enemy to death with the end of your bow  - whats the point? 

If you considering installing dont bother youll get more thrills from picking your nose for 2 minutes instead.

Thats the review, go away now!

review_title: Worst VR game I have ever played
one_reviews_text: This game is weird, the models look like they were taken from the unity store, so they are not original.  I'm fine with people using models from the unity store as long as the game is a fangame,  This is an original game with no relation to other games, so make your own models or make this a fangame of some sort.  Also there is almost no music in this game and only ambient music in the archery minigame, which is really unsettling and makes it feel like a horror game,  improve the graphics, use your own models, and add music and I might like this a bit more.

And to return to menu you have to press both pads with i don't even know what that is.

The archer mode was actually scary to me. great (unintended?) Horror. The lack of music and the footsteps of the soldiers closing in was scary af. This gamemode has huge potential imo.

review_title: Don't listen to haters, free and alright
one_reviews_text: This game has 3 different mini-games.  First one is a barebones Space Pirate Trainer clone with no shield (well your shield is the lightsaber) and only 1 type of gun.  Flying drones come at you from 180 degrees in front.  Dodge and shoot or use light saber to block the bullets.  3 stars on this one.  The second mini-game is a goalie soccer game with giant foam hands to block the balls being shot at you from 3 cannons.  This game is actually pretty decent to go for the high score. 4 stars.  The last, but not least, is a bow shooting mini-game.  You basically use a bow to shoot enemies or strike them melee style with your bow that spawn from anywhere (360).  You can dodge bullets and teleport around.  The bow is very easy to shoot.  4 stars.  So all together, I give the game 4 stars, keep in mind it is meant for Steam and that's where all the leaderboards are kept and none for the Oculus version :D
Rubbish. Simple as that. Don't waste the space on your hard drive
Should only release when there is no bugs or a small complete playability .
bugs.

Nothing extremely wrong except that to switch between games it wants you to use BOTH menu buttons... which means you can't exit a mini-game once you've started it without closing down the whole program since the right menu button takes you to the oculus menu.

Other than that it just doesn't really stand out at this time compared with the other free experiences.

Cool games inside. I like the archer one specifically cause I am a huge fan of archery. It can be smoothed out for sure, a few more games other than 3 (I do know their will be so i'm not complaining). Other than that I do recommend playing but its more as something to kill some time in its current state

Would be nice for them to throw maybe an update with some new features, but if you want to kill a little time, throw yourself into this and have a play around. Personally, i wasn't a big fan, although i do like the idea of having a games room type experience, i just wasn't that in to the games available. That's just my opinion though, yours may differ :)
...the worst thing i downloaded from Oculus Store... it's like someone tried to make a game for VR and decided to release it after version 0.00001
I looked at the games once and that was it. For the price of FREE I guess you can try it once, that's about it. Game is a case of abandonware.
Don't know about this one, as a game I found it okay. To be honest it felt more like a tech demo rather than a game - though to be fair it's nice of the dev to offer it for free.
A good attempt.  Free is appropriate.
I experienced some bugs but I had a fair bit of fun playing and it was free. So I would recomend giving it a try.

The environments look decent but the game play is shallow and brief. You get 3 games: shooting arrows at robots, shooting and swinging a laser sword, or being a soccer goal tender. I lasted a few minutes before getting bored. And then it crashed.

Check out these minigames. There are several other minigame apps available free on the Oculus store, but this one has a few unique ones like the Goalkeeper game where you block soccer balls from entering your net using extended arms, and the Drone Fight where you block lasers using a lightsaber. The minigame with the bow has been done with better controls on other apps, but you might as well check it out while you're there. No replay value, so once you've checked them out, that's about it.
Only reasonably good if it's your first VR experience.

I'm not an ungrateful person with a false sense of entitlement, and I'll not completely discourage the developers with insensitive, unnecessarily harsh feedback. I understand that someone has taken the time to create this piece of software and I appreciate that they've given their work away for free. I wouldn't be happy if I'd paid for it, but I didn't. It's free. It's a reasonable demonstration of what can be achieved in VR. Thank you, devs, and good luck with future projects.

Worth the download. Reflecting lasers with a lightsaber feels really cool. There are three games currently and they are all unqiue and fun in their own right. Its clearly unfinished so if you arent into that then don't download it just to rate it 1star.

Please pay attention that it's for free, so you can't compare with 30$ or 50$ titles. it's not bad - I think it makes sense to support developer at least with good mark for free game. Btw, game with lasers - quite good
Very nice free game. Good controls if you use experimental 360 degree sensor mode.

review_title: very short,but its fun and free!
one_reviews_text:
the bow and arrow game didnt work for me, my oculus touch controllers kept glitching on and off when i turned around.
and in the soccer game balls sometimes went through my hands, but for a free fun game this is awesome!
at least 15mins of fun :)

This game is in no way finished (December 2016). Please do not play this game until maybe march or june of 2017.  Theres nothing wrong with this game other then it being just at the very start of developement. There is no scores or point to this game yet, just a few very simple tech demos.

review_title: Really horrible, no effort put into it
one_reviews_text:
The bow game level is taken out of a sample from the Unreal Engine marketplace, wasn't even changed much, the developer even went through the effort of replacing the enemies with custom models (much worse ones)
The shooting/lightsaber game is slightly better but still garbage, the AI is not even shooting at you.
The goalkeeper game is quite decent actually, it has a nice unique feature of giant hands, if this was the only game and it was a bit more polished it would have probably gotten 4 stars.

Also it will make you very sick, as the developer decided to teleport you with motion, probably the worst possible way to move in VR
actually it has only 3 games inside and the soccer thing is boring the rest is okay nothing special, it has potential so insert more mini games
